The perch gestation period is usually between 1-2 weeks, but it may vary depending on factors such as water temperature and the specific species of perch.

Successful fertilization in perch depends on several factors, including the timing of the egg release by the female, the timing of the male sperm release, the water temperature, and the presence of appropriate spawning sites. Males and females also need to ensure their gametes are healthy and viable for successful fertilization. If all these factors are favorable, a high percentage of the eggs should be fertilized, leading to a successful hatch rate.
